ref: 14307 utphalati in mng. ʻ bursts ʼ rather from √phal2. -- M. uphā̆ḷṇẽ in mng. ʻ to boil or bubble up, rise (of flame), spring up (of water), swell (with pride) ʼ rather < *utsphalati Add. (√sphal2); Pk. upphālēi in mng. ʻ raises ʼ and M. uphāḷṇẽ ʻ to winnow ʼ < *ut -- sphālayati Add. (√sphal1).
